title: How to make a career change into the music technology industry - Quora

response.answer_text: Most of the paying gigs in music technology require programming and lots of it. Start with a user-friendly graphical programming tool. Max/MSP is ideal, since it was designed for music specifically. Next, pick up a scripting language or two -- Python and Javascript would seem to be the really useful ones these days. Finally, learn a "real" programming language or two, or three: C, C++, Java. You would also be well served by picking up some digital signal theory, music information retrieval and machine learning. (I'm hardly an expert on any of these things; maybe someone will put some good resources in the comments.) Finally, if you can produce mobile and web apps, you'll be highly desirable in any music technology setting. Good luck!
